circumstances: The Cessna 208A was on an IFR flight to haul freight from Aspen to Denver, Colorado. Moderate to heavy icing conditions were forecast for the Denver area. While on an ILS runway 36 approach, the aircraft encountered icing conditions. Subsequently, it entered a steep descent and crashed about 3 miles from the approach end of the runway. No preimpact part failure of the aircraft was found during the investigation. The 1950 mst weather at the airport was in part: 800 feet scattered, 1,000 feet broken, visibility 4 miles with freezing drizzle and snow showers, temp 28°, dew point 25°.
probable_cause: The accumulation of structural ice and subsequent stalling of the aircraft. The icing condition was a related factor.
